titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ جَهِلَ أَنْ يَقِفَ بِالْمَشْعَرِ
titles.en: Chapter 169 – The one who is ignorant that he should be pausing at the Monuments

titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ جَهِلَ أَنْ يَقِفَ بِالْمَشْعَرِ
titles.en: Chapter 169 – The one who is ignorant that he should be pausing at the Monuments

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَكِيمٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) الرَّجُلُ الْأَعْجَمِيُّ وَ الْمَرْأَةُ الضَّعِيفَةُ يَكُونَانِ مَعَ الْجَمَّالِ الْأَعْرَابِيِّ فَإِذَا أَفَاضَ بِهِمْ مِنْ عَرَفَاتٍ مَرَّ بِهِمْ كَمَا مَرَّ بِهِمْ إِلَى مِنًى وَ لَمْ يَنْزِلْ بِهِمْ جَمْعاً فَقَالَ أَ لَيْسَ قَدْ صَلَّوْا بِهَا فَقَدْ أَجْزَأَهُمْ قُلْتُ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يُصَلُّوا بِهَا قَالَ ذَكَرُوا اللَّهَ فِيهَا فَإِنْ كَانُوا ذَكَرُوا اللَّهَ فِيهَا فَقَدْ أَجْزَأَهُمْ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Abu Nasr, from Hammad Bin Usman, from Muhammad Bin Hakeym who said, 
‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The non-Arab man and the weak woman both happen to be with the Bedouin cameleer. So when he departs with them from Arafaat, he passes with them just as he passed with them to Mina and did not encamp with them at Jam’a’ (place of assembly near Muzdalifah). So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Had they Prayed at it, it would have sufficed them’. I said, ‘And if they did not Pray at it?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘They should mention Allah<sup>azwj</sup>. So if they had mentioned Allah<sup>azwj</sup> therein, so it would have sufficed them’.

verses.text:
مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ إِنَّ صَاحِبَيَّ هَذَيْنِ جَهِلَا أَنْ يَقِفَا بِالْمُزْدَلِفَةِ فَقَالَ يَرْجِعَانِ مَكَانَهُمَا فَيَقِفَانِ بِالْمَشْعَرِ سَاعَةً 
قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهُ لَمْ يُخْبِرْهُمَا أَحَدٌ حَتَّى كَانَ الْيَوْمُ وَ قَدْ نَفَرَ النَّاسُ قَالَ فَنَكَسَ رَأْسَهُ سَاعَةً ثُمَّ قَالَ أَ لَيْسَا قَدْ صَلَّيَا الْغَدَاةَ بِالْمُزْدَلِفَةِ قُلْتُ بَلَى فَقَالَ أَ لَيْسَا قَدْ قَنَتَا فِي صَلَاتِهِمَا قُلْتُ بَلَى فَقَالَ تَمَّ حَجُّهُمَا ثُمَّ قَالَ الْمَشْعَرُ مِنَ الْمُزْدَلِفَةِ وَ الْمُزْدَلِفَةُ مِنَ الْمَشْعَرِ وَ إِنَّمَا يَكْفِيهِمَا الْيَسِيرُ مِنَ الدُّعَاءِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Ibn Muskan, from Abu Baseer who said, 
‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! There two companions of mine who were ignorant (of the fact) that they should be pausing at Muzdalifa’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘They should both go back to their places, and they should pause at the Monuments for a while’. 
I said, ‘But no one informed them until today, and the people have left’. So he<sup>asws</sup> lowered his<sup>asws</sup> head for a while, then said: ‘Is it not so that both of them had Prayed the morning (Prayer) at Al-Muzdalifa?’ I said, ‘Yes’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Is it not so that they had both performed Qunoot in their Prayer?’ I said, ‘Yes’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Their Hajj is complete’. Then he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The Monuments are from Al-Muzdalifa, and Al-Muzdalifa is from the Monuments. But rather, a little from the supplication would suffice them’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مَا تَقُولُ فِي رَجُلٍ أَفَاضَ مِنْ عَرَفَاتٍ فَأَتَى مِنًى قَالَ فَلْيَرْجِعْ فَيَأْتِي جَمْعاً فَيَقِفُ بِهَا وَ إِنْ كَانَ النَّاسُ قَدْ أَفَاضُوا مِنْ جَمْعٍ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazl Bin Shazaan, from Safwan Bin Yahya, from Muawiya Bin Ammar who said, ‘I said to Abu Abdullahasws, ‘What are youasws saying regarding a man who departs from Arafaat, so he goes to Mina?’ Heasws said: ‘So let him return and go to Jam’a. So he should pause at it, and even if the people had departed from Jam’a’ (place of assembly near Muzdalifah).

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) رَجُلٌ أَفَاضَ مِنْ عَرَفَاتٍ فَمَرَّ بِالْمَشْعَرِ فَلَمْ يَقِفْ حَتَّى انْتَهَى إِلَى مِنًى وَ رَمَى الْجَمْرَةَ وَ لَمْ يَعْلَمْ حَتَّى ارْتَفَعَ النَّهَارُ قَالَ يَرْجِعُ إِلَى الْمَشْعَرِ فَيَقِفُ بِهِ ثُمَّ يَرْجِعُ فَيَرْمِي الْجَمْرَةَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazzal, from Yunus Bin Yaqoub who said, ‘I said to Abu Abdullahasws, ‘A man departs from Arafaat, so he passed by the ‘الْمَشْعَرِ’ Monuments, but he does not paused until he ends up to Mina and pelts the Jamarah, and he does not know until the day is raised’. Heasws said: ‘He should return to the ‘الْمَشْعَرِ’ Monuments, so he should pause at it, then he should return, so he would pelt the Jamarah’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ يَحْيَى الْخَثْعَمِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّهُ قَالَ فِي رَجُلٍ لَمْ يَقِفْ بِالْمُزْدَلِفَةِ وَ لَمْ يَبِتْ بِهَا حَتَّى أَتَى مِنًى فَقَالَ أَ لَمْ يَرَ النَّاسَ وَ لَمْ يُنْكِرْ مِنًى حِينَ دَخَلَهَا قُلْتُ فَإِنْ جَهِلَ ذَلِكَ قَالَ يَرْجِعُ قُلْتُ إِنَّ ذَلِكَ قَدْ فَاتَهُ فَقَالَ لَا بَأْسَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muhammad Bin Yahya Al Khas’amy, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said regarding a man who did not pause at Al-Muzdalifa, and did not sleep at it until he went to Mina. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Did he not see the people and did not deny (that he was in) Mina when he entered it?’ I said, ‘Supposing he was ignorant of that’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘He should return’. I said, ‘If that (opportunity) has been lost?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ أَفَاضَ مِنْ عَرَفَاتٍ مَعَ النَّاسِ وَ لَمْ يَلْبَثْ مَعَهُمْ بِجَمْعٍ وَ مَضَى إِلَى مِنًى مُتَعَمِّداً أَوْ مُسْتَخِفّاً فَعَلَيْهِ بَدَنَةٌ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Al Hassan Bin Mahboub, from Ali Bin Raib, from Hareyz, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who departs from Arafaat along with the people and does not remain with them at Jam’a, and goes to Mina deliberately, or by taking it lightly, so upon him is a camel (as a sacrifice)’.
